1.name: A Clockwork Orange
1.description: In the future, a sadistic gang leader is imprisoned and volunteers for a conduct-aversion experiment, but it doesn't go as planned.

2.name: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
2.description: A poor but hopeful boy seeks one of the five coveted golden tickets that will send him on a tour of Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory.

3.name: Dirty Harry
3.description: When a madman calling himself "the Scorpio Killer" (Andrew Robinson) menaces the city, tough as nails San Francisco Police Inspector "Dirty" Harry Callahan (Clint Eastwood) is assigned to track down and ferret out the crazed psychopath.

4.name: Fiddler on the Roof
4.description: In prerevolutionary Russia, a Jewish peasant contends with marrying off three of his daughters while growing anti-Semitic sentiment threatens his village.

5.name: Diamonds Are Forever
5.description: A diamond smuggling investigation leads James Bond to Las Vegas, where he uncovers an evil plot involving a rich business tycoon.

6.name: Straw Dogs
6.description: A young American and his English wife come to rural England and face increasingly vicious local harassment.

7.name: Bedknobs and Broomsticks
7.description: An apprentice witch, three kids and a cynical magician conman search for the missing component to a magic spell to be used in the defense of Britain in WWII.

8.name: Shaft
8.description: Cool black private eye John Shaft is hired by a crime lord to find and retrieve his kidnapped daughter.

9.name: The French Connection
9.description: A pair of NYC cops in the Narcotics Bureau stumble onto a drug smuggling job with a French connection.

10.name: Harold and Maude
10.description: Young, rich, and obsessed with death, Harold finds himself changed forever when he meets lively septuagenarian Maude at a funeral.

11.name: The Last Picture Show
11.description: In 1951, a group of high schoolers come of age in a bleak, isolated, atrophied West Texas town that is slowly dying, both culturally and economically.

12.name: The Devils
12.description: In 17th-century France, Father Urbain Grandier seeks to protect the city of Loudun from the corrupt establishment of Cardinal Richelieu. Hysteria occurs within the city when he is accused of witchcraft by a sexually repressed nun.

13.name: Night of Dark Shadows
13.description: A painter and his wife move into a home and find themselves plagued by ghosts and spirits of his ancestors that used to be witches.

14.name: Giù la testa
14.description: An I.R.A. explosives expert on the run in Mexico meets an amoral Mexican bandit; together they are drawn into the Mexican revolution.

15.name: THX 1138
15.description: In the twenty-fifth century, a time when people have designations instead of names, a man, THX 1138, and a woman, LUH 3417, rebel against their rigidly controlled society.

16.name: The Go-Between
16.description: A tale of torrid and forbidden love between a couple in the English countryside.

17.name: The Omega Man
17.description: Lone survivor, doctor Robert Neville, struggles to create a cure for the plague that wiped out most of the human race while fighting The Family, a savage luddite death cult formed by the zombie-like infected to erase the past.

18.name: Vanishing Point
18.description: During the 1970s, car delivery driver Kowalski delivers hot rods in record time but always runs into trouble with the highway cops.

19.name: The Beguiled
19.description: While imprisoned in a Confederate girls' boarding school, an injured Union soldier cons his way into each of the lonely women's hearts, causing them to turn on each other, and eventually, on him.

20.name: Walkabout
20.description: Two city-bred siblings are stranded in the Australian Outback, where they learn to survive with the aid of an Aboriginal boy on his "walkabout": a ritual separation from his tribe.

21.name: Mary, Queen of Scots
21.description: During the sixteenth century, the Catholic Mary, Queen of Scots engages in over two decades of religious and political conflict with her cousin, the Protestant Queen Elizabeth I of England, amidst political intrigue in her native land.

22.name: Play Misty for Me
22.description: A brief fling between disc jockey Dave Garver (Clint Eastwood) and obsessed female fan Evelyn Draper (Jessica Walter) takes a frightening, and perhaps even deadly turn when another woman, Tobie Williams (Donna Mills), enters the picture.

23.name: Lawman
23.description: A lawman from Bannock arrives in Sabbath to arrest all the cattlemen whose wild celebration the year before resulted in the accidental death of an old man.

24.name: The Andromeda Strain
24.description: A team of top scientists work feverishly in a secret, state-of-the-art laboratory to discover what has killed the citizens of a small town and learn how this deadly contagion can be stopped.

25.name: Klute
25.description: A small-town detective searching for a missing man has only one lead: a connection with a New York prostitute.

26.name: Carnal Knowledge
26.description: Chronicling the lifelong sexual development of two men who meet and befriend one another in college.

27.name: Get Carter
27.description: When his brother dies under mysterious circumstances in a car accident, London gangster Jack Carter travels to Newcastle to investigate.

28.name: Big Jake
28.description: In 1909, when John Fain's gang kidnaps Jacob McCandles' grandson and holds him for ransom, Big Jake sets out to rescue the boy.

29.name: Shoot Out
29.description: A former bank robber searches for his double crossing partner who left him for dead, while having to look after a 6 year old girl.

30.name: The Tragedy of Macbeth
30.description: A ruthlessly ambitious Scottish lord seizes the throne with the help of his scheming wife and a trio of witches.

31.name: Morte a Venezia
31.description: While recovering in Venice, sickly Composer Gustav von Aschenbach becomes dangerously fixated with teenager Tadzio.

32.name: Flight of the Doves
32.description: While fleeing across the Irish countryside, two orphans are pursued by their villainous uncle, a master of disguises.

33.name: The Panic in Needle Park
33.description: Follows the lives of heroin addicts who frequent "Needle Park" in New York City.

34.name: The Blood on Satan's Claw
34.description: Horror thriller set in 17th century England about the children of a village slowly converting into a coven of devil worshipers.

35.name: Il Decameron
35.description: An adaptation of nine stories from Boccaccio's "Decameron".

36.name: Twins of Evil
36.description: A religious sect led by Gustav Weil hunts all women suspected of witchcraft, killing a number of innocent victims. Young Katy, Gustav's niece, will involve herself in a devilish cult, and become an instrument of Justice in the region.

37.name: Le Mans
37.description: Almost in breadth and depth of a documentary, this movie depicts an auto race during the 70s on the world's hardest endurance course: Le Mans in France. The race goes over 24 hours on 14.5 ...                See full summary »

38.name: Wake in Fright
38.description: After a bad gambling bet, a schoolteacher is marooned in a town full of crazy, drunk, violent men who threaten to make him just as crazy, drunk, and violent.

39.name: Billy Jack
39.description: Ex-Green Beret hapkido expert saves wild horses from being slaughtered for dog food and helps protect a desert "freedom school" for runaway.

40.name: Ecologia del delitto
40.description: The murder of a wealthy heiress by her husband triggers a series of brutal killings in the surrounding bay area.

41.name: Pretty Maids All in a Row
41.description: California State Police Captain Sam Surcher investigates a string of teenage girl murders at Oceanfront High School.

42.name: Les lèvres rouges
42.description: A newlywed couple are passing through a vacation resort. Their paths cross with a mysterious, strikingly beautiful countess and her aide.

43.name: The Abominable Dr. Phibes
43.description: A doctor, scientist, organist, and biblical scholar, Anton Phibes, seeks revenge on the nine doctors he considers responsible for his wife's death.

44.name: Lust for a Vampire
44.description: In 1830, forty years to the day since the last manifestation of their dreaded vampirism, the Karnstein heirs use the blood of an innocent to bring forth the evil that is the beautiful ...                See full summary »

45.name: Anand
45.description: The story of a terminally ill man who wishes to live life to the full before the inevitable occurs, as told by his best friend.

46.name: Tang shan da xiong
46.description: A young man sworn to an oath of non-violence works with his cousins in an ice factory where they mysteriously begin to disappear.

47.name: The House That Dripped Blood
47.description: An anthology of four horror stories revolving around a mysterious rental house in the U.K.

48.name: Johnny Got His Gun
48.description: In this tragic, dark, anti-war satire, a patriotic young American in WW1 is rendered blind, deaf, limbless, and mute by a horrific artillery shell attack. Trapped in what's left of his body, he desperately looks for a way to end his life.

49.name: Summer of '42
49.description: During his summer vacation on Nantucket Island in 1942, a youth eagerly awaiting his first sexual encounter finds himself developing an innocent love for a young woman awaiting news on her soldier husband's fate in WWII.

50.name: Two-Lane Blacktop
50.description: 2 men drag-racing across the U.S., in a '55 Chevy. Dennis Wilson's the mechanic, James Taylor's the driver.
